column13: As part of our ongoing partnership with The Resilience Project, we provided team members and their families with information and access to mental resilience resources. column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column13: Our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), delivered by Converge International, provides team members and their families with free and confidential 24/7 tailored support across a broad range of work-related and personal issues and includes specialised support lines such as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTQI+, Domestic Violence and Financial Support. Multilingual EAP flyers are also made available, and the team can access a live chat function to talk with a counsellor directly.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, Converge International, Free and Confidential 24/7 Tailored Support

column6: Work-related ill health
Average hours of training per year per employee
Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column7: Coles provides a range of programs at all levels of the organisation to upskill team members and support career progression - this is covered in our Sustainability report under Great Place to Work p. 37. Coles is also committed to supporting team members transitioning from our business due to retirement, redundancy or termination. This can include reskilling programs through TAFE, learning resources, outplacement and employee assistance programs.\n

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column7: All Coles salaried team members and store leaders have annual performance reviews, and we encourage continuous conversations all year round that include receiving regular feedback on performance and development progress. Our performance management process is captured in real-time using an online system.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: We remain committed to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander recruitment and retention and, as part of the refreshed Team that is Better Together strategy, we will continue to build our Indigenous workforce population year-on-year beyond 3.2%. A pilot program focusing on identifying opportunities for Indigenous recruitment and retention in our Big Fish Caboolture supermarket in Queensland has yielded positive outcomes, with more than 30 Indigenous team members employed since the opening in November 2022 and a retention rate of more than 80%.
column20: Big Fish Caboolture, Queensland, Indigenous Team

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: We remain committed to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander recruitment and retention and, as part of the refreshed Team that is Better Together strategy, we will continue to build our Indigenous workforce population year-on-year beyond 3.2%. Coles is implementing lessons from the Big Fish trial into new supermarkets in Aspley and Deception Bay and the Nguru Mandin (Redbank) automated distribution centre in Queensland to encourage higher Indigenous employment in those locations.
